readable_content: - Washington Post (2023-12-08): The trillions of plastic particles in the oceans, doubling every six years, weigh roughly 2.4 million metric tons and equate to over 170 trillion pieces of plastic. Only 10% of plastic ever made has been recycled, and the plastic pollution issue has reached unprecedented levels. The study draws on nearly 12,000 samples collected over 40 years, and research into plastics pollution has shifted to rivers and other waterways as advocates seek to understand the issue at its origin. The study may provide momentum to U.N. talks to reduce global plastics pollution.
summary:
The article highlights the alarming increase in plastic pollution in the oceans, calling attention to the urgent need for action to address this environmental crisis. It stresses the importance of understanding the origins of plastic pollution and the need for global efforts to reduce it. The sentiment of the article is undoubtedly one of concern and urgency.
